message.content:
cs.IT, cs.GT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the problem of coordinating agents in a distributed network, which is a common topic in several subfields of computer science. However, the specific focus on power control and the use of coding techniques suggest that the paper is most likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Game Theory (cs.GT) is also a possible sub-category, given the emphasis on the common payoff function of the agents. The use of wireless channels and observations of signal-to-interference plus noise ratio suggest the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The repeated actions and realizations of the system state suggest the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the numerical analysis and optimization of power control policies suggest the Mathematical Optimization (cs.MA) sub-category.
